title: How to Draw Ferb Fletcher from Phineas and Ferb

steps.headline: Outline sketch the head with a long standing rectangle.
steps.description: Cartoon heads often consists of different basic shapes. Cartoonists designs their heads based on the character's personality.

steps.headline: Add another rectangle to outline sketch the body.
Draw the outline sketches of the hands and feet.
Add the outline sketches of the eyes, lip, ears and hair.
Outline sketch the clothes.
Start the actual lines with the shape of the head.
Detailed outline sketch Ferb's nose with an oval and two horizontal lines.
Draw the actual lines for the nose and ears.
Draw the actual lines for one of the eyes.
Draw the other eye's actual lines.
Actual line the hair.
Add the actual lines of the arms and hands.
steps.description: Always remember that most cartoon character designs only have four fingers.

steps.headline: Draw the actual lines of the clothes.
steps.description: Ferb's clothes were differently designed from Phineas'. His have a lot more shapes on it.

steps.headline: Add the actual lines of the legs and feet.
Erase the outline sketches.
Fill in the basic colors.
Add the shadows and background.
Outline sketch the head and the body with two rectangles and a cross line on the face.
Outline sketch the book.
Outline sketch the arms, hands, legs and feet.
Add the outline sketch of the eyes, nose, mouth and ears.
Continue with the outline sketch of the hair.
Draw the actual lines of the head.
Add the actual lines of the book.
Complete the actual lines and erase the outline sketches.
Fill in the basic colors.
Add the shadows and the background.
Draw a rectangle that is slightly wider on top.
steps.description: Draw another rectangle below the first one, make the edges into curved instead of angled.

steps.headline: Add a banana-like shape on top of your first rectangle, this is a guide in drawing the hair later.
steps.description: Draw the hands and feet, you can use two curved lines for the hands and sausage shapes for the fingers. The feet can be drawn using an oblong.

steps.headline: Draw the eyes, draw a small circle and a bigger one adjacent to it.
steps.description: 3The shaded part would look like a crescent moon. Draw a half square for the nose, one-third of the bigger eye is covered by the nose. On the opposite side of the nose, draw the ears using an inverted C shape with a number 3 inside it. Draw an angle for the mouth.

steps.headline: Draw curved lines that form into pointed angles for the hair.
Draw Ferb's shirt.
steps.description: For the collar, you can draw two inverted triangles that overlap each other. Add a small circle at the center for Ferb's button. Sketch a rectangle for the sleeves. Draw the top of Ferb's pants, and the belt using four squares. On the knee area, draw two rectangles.

steps.headline: Add a few details to the shoes using small strokes.
steps.description: Just above the sole of the shoes draw a horizontal line and at the center of the shoe, you can add a vertical curved line. For the socks, just add a small line above the shoe.

steps.headline: Erase unnecessary lines and refine desired lines from your outline.
Color your drawing.
Draw a rectangle that is slightly wider on top.
steps.description: Draw another  shape that would look like a curved rectangle below the first one, make the edges into curved instead of angled.

steps.headline: Add a banana-like shape on top of your first rectangle, this is a guide in drawing the hair later.
steps.description: Draw the hands and feet, for the arms you can use two straight lines and for fingers, add sausage shapes. Draw another set of parallel lines for the legs. The feet can be drawn using an oblong.

steps.headline: Draw the eyes, draw a small circle and a bigger one adjacent to it.
steps.description: Add a smaller circle shade half of the space with black for the pupils. The shaded part would look like a crescent moon. Draw a half square for the nose, one-third of the bigger eye is covered by the nose. On the opposite side of the nose, draw the ears using an inverted C shape with a number 3 inside it. Draw an angle for the mouth.

steps.headline: Draw curved lines that form into pointed angles for the hair.
Draw Ferb's shirt.
steps.description: For the collar, you can draw two inverted triangles that overlap each other. Add a small circle at the center for Ferb's button. Sketch a rectangle for the sleeves. Draw the top of Ferb's pants, and the belt using four squares. On the knee area, draw two rectangles.

steps.headline: Add a few details to the shoes using small strokes.
steps.description: Just above the sole of the shoes draw two vertical lines and at the center of the shoe, you can add a horizontal curved line. For the socks, just add a small line above the shoe.

steps.headline: Erase unnecessary lines and refine desired lines from your outline.
Color your drawing.

text: Standing Ferb Outline sketch the head with a long standing rectangle. Cartoon heads often consists of different basic shapes. Cartoonists designs their heads based on the character's personality. Add another rectangle to outline sketch the body.  Draw the outline sketches of the hands and feet.  Add the outline sketches of the eyes, lip, ears and hair.  Outline sketch the clothes.  Start the actual lines with the shape of the head.  Detailed outline sketch Ferb's nose with an oval and two horizontal lines.  Draw the actual lines for the nose and ears.  Draw the actual lines for one of the eyes.  Draw the other eye's actual lines.  Actual line the hair.  Add the actual lines of the arms and hands. Always remember that most cartoon character designs only have four fingers. Draw the actual lines of the clothes. Ferb's clothes were differently designed from Phineas'. His have a lot more shapes on it. Add the actual lines of the legs and feet.  Erase the outline sketches.  Fill in the basic colors.  Add the shadows and background.  Reading Outline sketch the head and the body with two rectangles and a cross line on the face.  Outline sketch the book.  Outline sketch the arms, hands, legs and feet.  Add the outline sketch of the eyes, nose, mouth and ears.  Continue with the outline sketch of the hair.  Draw the actual lines of the head.  Add the actual lines of the book.  Complete the actual lines and erase the outline sketches.  Fill in the basic colors.  Add the shadows and the background.  Ferb Standing Draw a rectangle that is slightly wider on top. Draw another rectangle below the first one, make the edges into curved instead of angled. Add a banana-like shape on top of your first rectangle, this is a guide in drawing the hair later. Draw the hands and feet, you can use two curved lines for the hands and sausage shapes for the fingers. The feet can be drawn using an oblong. Draw the eyes, draw a small circle and a bigger one adjacent to it. 3The shaded part would look like a crescent moon. Draw a half square for the nose, one-third of the bigger eye is covered by the nose. On the opposite side of the nose, draw the ears using an inverted C shape with a number 3 inside it. Draw an angle for the mouth. Draw curved lines that form into pointed angles for the hair.  Draw Ferb's shirt. For the collar, you can draw two inverted triangles that overlap each other. Add a small circle at the center for Ferb's button. Sketch a rectangle for the sleeves. Draw the top of Ferb's pants, and the belt using four squares. On the knee area, draw two rectangles. Add a few details to the shoes using small strokes. Just above the sole of the shoes draw a horizontal line and at the center of the shoe, you can add a vertical curved line. For the socks, just add a small line above the shoe. Erase unnecessary lines and refine desired lines from your outline.  Color your drawing.  Ferb Sitting Draw a rectangle that is slightly wider on top. Draw another  shape that would look like a curved rectangle below the first one, make the edges into curved instead of angled. Add a banana-like shape on top of your first rectangle, this is a guide in drawing the hair later. Draw the hands and feet, for the arms you can use two straight lines and for fingers, add sausage shapes. Draw another set of parallel lines for the legs. The feet can be drawn using an oblong. Draw the eyes, draw a small circle and a bigger one adjacent to it. Add a smaller circle shade half of the space with black for the pupils. The shaded part would look like a crescent moon. Draw a half square for the nose, one-third of the bigger eye is covered by the nose. On the opposite side of the nose, draw the ears using an inverted C shape with a number 3 inside it. Draw an angle for the mouth. Draw curved lines that form into pointed angles for the hair.  Draw Ferb's shirt. For the collar, you can draw two inverted triangles that overlap each other. Add a small circle at the center for Ferb's button. Sketch a rectangle for the sleeves. Draw the top of Ferb's pants, and the belt using four squares. On the knee area, draw two rectangles. Add a few details to the shoes using small strokes. Just above the sole of the shoes draw two vertical lines and at the center of the shoe, you can add a horizontal curved line. For the socks, just add a small line above the shoe. Erase unnecessary lines and refine desired lines from your outline.  Color your drawing.
